text: Tomas Milian (born Tomás Quintín Rodríguez; 3 March 1933 – 22 March 2017) was a Cuban American-Italian actor and singer. He was known for his roles in The Big Gundown (1966), The Ugly Ones (1967), Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot! (1967), Face to Face (1967), Run, Man, Run (1968), Death Sentence (1968), Tepepa (1969), Compañeros (1970), Sonny and Jed (1972), Life Is Tough, Eh Providence? (1972), Don't Torture a Duckling (1972) and Four of the Apocalypse (1975). Milian was born in Havana, Cuba. He studied at the Actors Studio in New York City. He was a bisexual. Milian died at his home in Miami, Florida on 22 March 2017 from a stroke, aged 84. ==References== ==Other websites== * Tomás Milián official site * *Tomás Milián interview * Tomas Milian in The Designated Victim – TCM's Movie Morlocks Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American LGBT people Category:LGBT actors Category:Bisexual people Category:Italian movie actors Category:Italian television actors Category:Italian stage actors Category:Italian LGBT people Category:Actors from Havana Category:Actors from Miami
title: Tomas Milian
